Text: Project Mercury was the first U.S. Space program, with the goal of safely launching an astronaut into orbit and safely returning to Earth.
Project Gemini was the 2nd space program in the US, and ofter referred as the Bridge to the Moon.
Project Apollo is the program that eventually landed men on the Moon.
Mercury Control Center Live is a multiplayer module where multiple mission controllers can support a Mercury mission.
Mission Operations Control Center Live allows multiple mission controllers to support an Apollo mission through the MOCR.

WARNING: This will reset all default checklists to factory settings. Please create a backup if you have made any modifications to the default checklists.
Your own checklists will not be affected.
Automatically check for default checklist changes.

The cockpit camera points/view snap points are copied into (Reentry persistent data path under AppData)/Cameras. This file can be modified to change each of the camera points if you desired. It is important to update this file with game updates as new camera points might be added, or existing changed due to feature updates.

WARNING: This will reset all default camera snap points to factory settings. Please create a backup if you have made any modifications to these and merge them back into the updated file.
Automatically check for default camera point changes.

WARNING: This will reset all default panel states to factory settings. Please create a backup if you have made any modifications to the default panel states.
Your own panel states will not be affected.
This will create autosave states during some critical points such as at Insertion, Lunar SOI, PDI, etc.

VR Mouse Cursor is a brand new feature that I am working on. This will disable the VR Motion Controllers and use the mouse cursor combined with gaze direction to interact with the cockpit panels, and the UI. UI detection is currently not great and is what I focus on now.
Enable VR Controller vibrations during burns
Use a VR Mouse Cursor instead of Motion Controllers
WARNING: This will clear all user data such as settings, progress, time in space etc, and will not be recoverable.

This will export the OBC, AGC and LGC panel data in real time to dedicated files in the Exports folder (in the AppData folder for Reentry). This can be used to display the data on external devices (such as IoT).
The cockpit cursor will replace the mouse cursor and provide in-game features such as color change while hovering switches. The downside is that it will be rendered in the normal render loop.

Reflection probes are used to render all types of reflection. From the reflection lights planets cast while you are in orbit (general probes), to internal cockpit reflections seen in gauges, windows and reflective materials (critical probes). They are very taxing on your system.
If you use a slower update frequency, I also suggest to turn off WINDOW GLARE.

OFF: All reflection probes will be turned off
LOW: Critical probes will be updated over fourteen frames, Max resolution: 256
MEDIUM: Critical probes will be updated over nine frames, Max resolution: 512
HIGH: Critical probes will be updated within one frame.
ULTIMATE: All probes will be updated within one frame.

Multiple post processing effects are used to enhance the visual experience. They require some GPU and CPU cycles so consider turning these off to improve framerate (or if you dislike them). Effects are Bloom, Color Grading, AO, etc.
Enhanced SSAO is a way to render shadows and dark areas in tight geometrical spots such as corners, holes, etc. If you need the extra cycles elsewhere, consider turning this off.

This will render internal reflection in the main cockpit windows. The darker the cockpit, the less reflection you will see. It's therefore recommended to turn off lights if you will perform tasks where looking out the windows are critical.
If the reflection probe setting above is set to one of the lower settings (except off), I recommend turning this off as the reflections will have a delay in updates

Enabling this will render 3D models of the crew inside the CSM and LM. Mercury &
Gemini models, as well as a proper face/avatar generator is in development.
Lunar Rocks are part of the final phase of the descent, and is rendered on the lunar surface. These are quite taxing for some systems, so if things are slow, try to uncheck this.
As you drive the LRV, sand is picked up by the wheels. These are simulated by particles. This can be taxing, so if things are slow while driving, try to uncheck this.
The Command Module Interior upgrade will replace the existing low poly interior. The panels will remain the same, but the interior will be more realistic, but also very expensive to render.

When in orbit around the Moon, a method names Tessellation generates the lunar details. This is done on the GPU and can be quite expensive to render. Three parameters lets you control the tessellation: Factor, Minimum Distance and Maximum Distance.
Factor defines how much to tesselate. Common values are 1, 8, 16, 32 etc. The Minimum and Maximum distance defines the window of what to Tessellate. The things closer to you than Minimum Distance will be 100% Tessellated. The things further away from Maximum Distance will be 0% Tessellated. If something is further away than minimum but closer than maximum, it will be tessellated based on interpolation.
Apollo: Render High End Launch Complex 39A
This will render the Apollo Launch Complex 39A with a ultra high level of detail model.
Enabling this will draw a cube around the instrument or switch your mouse cursor is hovering.
Enabling this will draw an indicator in the direction of a highlighted switch, if this switch is located outside the player view.

If you use the RUN feature in checklists, the guide will automatically proceed until you reach a step that requires your attention. If this is disabled, you need to press PRO to move to the next step.

Enabling this will make rendezvous and orbital maneuvering burns a bit simpler with some automatic guidance corrections when logic detects accumulated errors or target offsets. I recommend leaving this on especially with guidance computers being in their early stages. Game logic can override this in critical places.
Enabling this will reduce the amount shaking on the camera during an Apollo Saturn V ascent (SIC and SII).
Enabling this will render a flag pole at the selected landing site when transitioned into the lunar landing area.
Automatically face the Lunar Landing Site
Enabling this will automatically orient the Lunar Module to face the direction of the landing site when transitioned into the lunar landing area.

This will enable random failures in missions that allows for this (Free Play or custom missions). The random failures system will roll a dice once every 25 - 35 minutes (cycle), where a random failure have a chance of happening. Below you can configure the chance a random failure can happen for each cycle, and what failures you wish to exclude from the list. Please note you can manually trigger a failure in-game using the failure console command.
% change of a failure to happen on each cycle.

Below you can configure the chance a random failure can happen for each cycle, and what failures you wish to exclude from the list. Please note you can manually trigger a failure in-game using the failure console command.

The random failures system will roll a dice once every 25 - 35 minutes (cycle), where a random failure have a chance of happening. Below you can configure the chance a random failure can happen for each cycle, and what failures you wish to exclude from the list. Please note you can manually trigger a failure in-game using the failure console command.

If enabled, the gyros will accumulate errors over time and will need to be corrected (Not affecting the LM as P52 has not been developed for it yet)
If enabled, you will need to replace the CO2 canisters manually according to procedures. Manual replacement is supported in the CSM and soon the LM.
With this setting enabled, a mission will require you to land and splash down in the ocean, not on land, to complete the mission.
LESSON 7 - THE MEDS AND THE DPS
SATURN V - COLD & DARK - GROUND CREW (T-4h)
Enabling this will hide the switch highlighter box that surrounds a switch highlighted by a checklist or mission command.
Toggling this will disable structural damage and game over due to heavy G-Loads during entry and ascent.
VIDEOS: SPACE FLIGHT ACADEMY: Lunar Module (YT)
VIDEOS: SPACE FLIGHT ACADEMY: Command Module (YT)
This will enable Orbital Decay (Testing only, Mercury Only), meaning your orbit will decay relative to how much drag the atmosphere produces.
This will stop timescale if Master Alarm is active (Apollo).
This will automatically rotate the spacecraft in a prograde direction while in Orbit.
All translations are contributed by the community, and is mostly partial. If you wish to contribute with language translations, please see the Contribute page on the Main Menu.

Note: VR has moved - a new VR implementation is in development! The existing preliminary VR support has moved into a dedicated branch named Virtual Reality. The development of a new VR implementation leveraging what I learned in the preliminary phase will replace the old implementation. The old implementation will be scrapped.

Alpha Features are various features and game modes that are currently in alpha/in-development. You can use this section to opt-in on any of these features. These are features that are currently in a Research & Development stage. You can read all about each feature in the ROADMAP section accessible from the Main Menu.
All of these features are automatically enabled if you run any build on the ALPHA-FLOOR branch accessible from the Steam Betas tab.

Note: Changes to this list requires a restart of the game.

Updates to the default checklists available

Updates to the default checklists are available and ready to be installed. By doing this, any changes you have made to the default checklists will be overwritten, so make backups before proceeding.

To install these changes, you can press the RESET DEFAULT CHECKLISTS button from SETTINGS, or by pressing INSTALL below.

NOTE: If you have made modifications to any of the default checklists, this message will show. I would recommend you to untoggle the "Automatically check for checklist changes" in SETTINGS to disable this message, and manually use the RESET DEFAULT CHECKLISTS function.
You can use the console command sp or setsunphase to modify the sun phase/position.
If you have feedback, please visit our official Discord channel at discord.gg/reentrygame
Avoid timescaling above 500x as it accumulates inaccuracies on internal systems.
The text-to-speech system can read out mission messages and lesson instructions in realtime. You can toggle this in settings.
We welcome every Virtual Astronaut to the Official Reentry Community over at our Discord server (discord.gg/reentrygame)!
Every spacecraft supported by Reentry has a flight manual. It is recommended to get familiar with these. You can find them at the Academy section.
We are frequently searching for new Test Pilots (TP)! The TP-platform is Discord, and is part of the official Reentry Discord Channel (discord.gg/reentrygame)
You can create your own checklists or modify existing ones using the Checklist Editor. You can create and load checklists using the 'checklist' command in the in-game console
Avoid timescaling above 500x as it accumulates inaccuracies on internal systems.
The text-to-speech system can read out mission messages and lesson instructions in realtime. You can toggle this in settings.
The reflection probes require a lot of processing power. Try reducing it's setting or turn them OFF, especially for Apollo.
The in-game keyboard buttons for the OBC and the DSKY can be mapped in the Input Settings.
You can map a hotkey for cutting the Lunar Module DPS on Lunar Contact.
Avoid timescaling above 500x as it accumulates inaccuracies on internal systems.
The text-to-speech system can read out mission messages and lesson instructions in realtime. You can toggle this in settings.
Quicksave: You can assign a Quicksave keyboard/joystick button in the Input Mapper.
This will disable camera shake in all cockpits.

The ORDEAL in the Command Module and the Lunar Module has two modes: ORB RATE and INERTIAL. INERTIAL will display the current IMU/GDC attitude on the FDAI, while ORB RATE will show the Local Vertical Local Horizontal (LVLH) on the FDAI.

This setting enables a simplified ORDEAL logic when the ORDEAL is set to ORB RATE. It temporarily adjusts the IMU/GDC inertial platforms to match the LVLH. When the ORDEAL is returned to INERTIAL mode, the adjusted IMU/GDC platforms will revert to their original settings.
This allows auto-maneuvering and attitudes to align with the selected ORDEAL mode.
Some academy lessons assume this is set to ON.
Setting this to OFF will make the ORDEAL only adjust the FDAI ball without affecting the orientation of the IMU/GDC. This means all attitude information, auto-maneuvering, and targeting will be relative to the IMU, and the ORB RATE mode will be visual only. This is the most realistic option, and I recommend that those familiar with the IMU, REFSMMATs, P52, and attitude control set this to OFF, along with the Automatic Prograde Realism setting.
Press SHIFT+M to open the Flight Documents. This allows you to read the manuals and use a browser in-game to open up pdfs, web sites etc.

I recommend learning Mercury fully, before starting Project Gemini. Then learn Gemini and rendezvous/docking, before attempting Apollo. This will let you learn the game mechanics, and the technology as it evolved in real life.

The "Apollo By The Numbers" book (link found in the Apollo Flight Documents browser (SHIFT+M to toggle) is a great reference to use when planning burns or trying to figure out what LOI parameters to use.
You can change/add Loading Screen images by replacing or adding files to the LoadingImages directory in the games AppData folder.
Got a dark area in the cockpit or need additional light? You can always toggle the Flashlight using [F] to make it easier to see in dark areas.
This toggle will automatically make the Mission Complete screen pop up when completing a mission / splash down. If disabled, you can call it by pressing ESC -> End Session.
This will disable the lens flare effect and instead render the sun as a bright blob.
Restrict Camera Movement to Cockpit Interior
Stops the camera when it reaches cockpit walls, preventing movement beyond the interior.
Displays visual markers to help you identify stars. Stars stored in the AGC are highlighted with a blue halo.
External View: Invert X-Axis during Mouse Look
Apollo: Blue Color Tint on Integral Light
The original integral color on the Apollo panels were white. This setting will override it with a slight ice blue tint.
